text: The past two weeks with the Chevy Blazer
SS have been fantastic. This is one in
habanero orange, which you know, take or
leave the color here, but the size, the
shape, the styling of it, and everything
about it has been really great for my
family of four. And there's a good
amount of utility here. You've got a
really big back trunk, little hatch.
There's a tiny little bit of space
underneath here, which you can throw
some groceries down there, keep your
charging equipment. So, really good big
space here. The seats go down in a 60/40
split, which isn't my favorite. I would
prefer if this just went down, but it is
functional enough to where you can throw
longer items on one side and still have
seating on the right. In terms of
seating on the back, you have plenty of
room for two booster seats. Could
probably fit a third one there if you
absolutely had to. Little trim piece
here, the sportiness with the orange
matching color for the seat belts. Lots
of space down here so the kids can have
plenty of room to not kick your seat and
still put things down there. I like the
little controls that they're handheld
and just real simple. You don't have to
get too fancy with the tech on that and
it just works really well. In terms of
the interior and the tech, I'm a big fan
of this actually. These are cloth seats
because they're the racing seats which
are always cloth and they are heated and
ventilated. Really appreciate that. Then
you have lots of buttons in everywhere
which some people don't like but I
personally think are just nice and
convenient right here if you want to
change the AC that's off that's on
really just nothing else. They have a
row of buttons here which is nice to
just always have these available and
they're not changing with the UI
updates. And this screen is actually
something to be talked about as well but
let me hop in the driver's seat for
that. The steering wheel here has lots
of buttons and things, which for me does
take a little while to get used to, but
it does have super cruise. And in my
testing, it worked exceptionally well.
This thing really does a good job of
keeping in your lane and speeding up and
slowing down. The range here, it's
showing 301, but honestly, it's more
like 320. It says 100%, but I've
actually driven quite a bit already. So,
320 plus miles. Very good. Very good
amount of range. Now, this car doesn't
have Apple CarPlay, which I think is a
miss, but it does have Google built in,
which means that you can actually do
things like install all kinds of stuff
from the Play Store. Like, I have a
Chrome web browser. I have the Max,
Spotify, YouTube itself, YouTube Music,
Ways, News, all kinds of apps that are
available to you, which I really like.
Except it doesn't work with things like
Apple Music, which is what me and my
family tend to use. So, that is a
bummer. Of course, you can Bluetooth
through it, but having the native apps
is really nice. Again, this screen is
fantastic and having everything in here
in the Google Play Store is a benefit,
but it still is not as good as my mind
of just having it automatically work
with everything that my phone already
does. So, the question is to you guys,
what do you think? Is this something
that you would buy? Because for me,
